openpas.basics

Interface Expressions.Expression<Op extends LogicalOps.LogicalOp>

  • Enclosing class:
    Expressions

    public static interface Expressions.Expression<Op extends LogicalOps.LogicalOp>
    Generic interface to represent all supported propositional expressions. An expression is construed to be a series of literals connected using an operator. For example, a series of literals connected using BinaryAnd is a term.

    • Method Detail

      • getOp

        Op getOp()
        Get the operator of this expression.
        Returns:
        An instance of an operator deriving from LogicalOps.BinaryOp

      • getLiterals

        java.lang.Iterable<Literal> getLiterals()
        Returns a series of literals for this expression. The order may or may not be significant depending on the type of the expression.
        Returns:

      • getLength

        int getLength()
        Returns the number of literals in this expression.
        Returns:

      • cloneExpression

        Expressions.Expression<Op> cloneExpression()
        Returns a clone of this expression. This should retain any characteristics of the cloned expression (e.g. ordering of literals).
        Returns:

      • isFalse

        boolean isFalse()
        Returns whether this expression evaluates to falsity, ie. it's always false.
        Returns:

      • isTrue

        boolean isTrue()
        Returns whether this expression evaluates to a tautology, ie. it's always true.
        Returns:

      • isContained

        boolean isContained(Literal lit)
        Returns true if this literal exists in this expression.
        Parameters:
        lit -
        Returns:

      • addLiteral

        boolean addLiteral(Literal lit)
        Add the given literal to this expression. After this operation the literal should exit in the expression such that isContained(Literal) returns true.
        Parameters:
        lit -
        Returns:
        true if the literal wasn't already in the expression (but is now added). False if the literal is already in.

      • removeLiteral

        boolean removeLiteral(Literal lit)
        Remove the given literal from this expression such that it no longer exists in the expression (ie. isContained(Literal) returns false).
        Parameters:
        lit -
        Returns:
        Returns true if the call made the change, False if is the literal already didn't exist in the expression.

      • addLiterals

        Expressions.Expression<Op> addLiterals(java.lang.Iterable<Literal> lit)
        Adds the series of given literals to the expression, functionaly it's the same as calling addLiteral for each literal.
        Parameters:
        lit -
        Returns:
        Returns "this" for convenience.

      • computeProbability

        double computeProbability()
        Returns the probability of this expression. This is only defined if all the literals in the expression are assumptions. If not, then it returns NaN. This is here for the following reasons: 1) It should always be a simple operation to computer the probability of an expression. 2) The probability is fully encapsulated in the expression even if not always defined. 3) There may be inherent efficiency gains to compute this inside its implementation class.
        Returns:
        A probability value x \in [0,1] if possible, NaN if not.
